events.message: The policyholder reported a car accident that occurred on the morning of April 1st, involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection.
Based on the initial report, the claim was categorized under Auto Accident due to the involvement of a vehicle collision in the incident.
An insurance agent specialized in auto claims was assigned to handle and assist the policyholder throughout the claim process.
The claim was officially acknowledged and the policyholder was informed that the case is now under review by the insurance company.
The insurance agent requested all necessary documents, including the police report, photos of the damaged vehicle, and proof of insurance.
The policyholder submitted all the requested documents promptly to facilitate the speedy processing of the auto accident claim.
The insured vehicle was inspected and the circumstances of the collision began to be reviewed by the claims investigation team.
After a thorough review of the accident details and documentation, the investigation team completed their assessment of the claim.
A settlement offer was proposed to the policyholder covering repairs and compensation for the damages caused by the auto accident.
The policyholder responded positively with feedback on the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the support provided.
Following the acceptance of the proposed settlement, the claim was officially approved to proceed to payment issuance.
The agreed claim settlement payment was issued to the policyholder's account for the repairs of the damaged vehicle.
The claim file was formally closed after confirming that the policyholder received the payment and the vehicle was repaired.
All documents and records related to the auto accident claim were archived securely for future reference and compliance.
